name: NPR
text: Danielle Ponder's song "Poor Man's Pain" was inspired by her work as a public defender. "These songs, I think, are timeless, because we have not found a way to end the pain and suffering of Black people in this country," she says. https://t.co/qWKkmC15nb

name: NPR
text: The storm is predicted to hit Okinawa Sunday, before moving onto the central island of Kyushu. https://t.co/PONptXbE27

name: NPR
text: New: A federal judge in California has ordered the Trump administration to temporarily stop wrapping up in-person counting efforts for the 2020 census. https://t.co/WRLU54oQ0a

name: NPR
text: The first national study to document depression severity during the pandemic found that 27.8% of adults reported symptoms of depression — up from 8.5% the last time the same questionnaire was administered. @commonhealth https://t.co/ciqDG1lOXS

name: NPR
text:
RT @hansilowang: BREAKING: A federal judge in California has ordered the Census Bureau to stop winding down in-person counting efforts for the #2020Census until court hearing is held on 9/17 in lawsuit by National Urban League-led coalition pushing for more time to count.
https://t.co/6Ho5hxUmon

name: NPR
text:
Review: Set in a version of our world where ghosts and fairies are real — and an Apache girl can pal around with the spirit of her childhood dog — "Elatsoe" is a warm, spooky novel that braids humor and horror into each other.
https://t.co/XorPx1iKY1

name: NPR
text: Review: Peter Strzok is one of the most notorious FBI officials in history. As much as he and his publisher may want his book to be about Trump or the counterintelligence business, it clearly can't avoid being about him. https://t.co/65IBOknyod

name: NPR
text:
Last year, we reported on a Mongolian heavy metal band whose epic music videos were racking up millions of views on YouTube. Since then, they've released a single for the video game "Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order."
https://t.co/UU2D4KzdBR

name: NPR
text:
It may not be the most obvious movie choice for the pandemic, but in watching Michael Mann's 1995 crime epic "Heat," our critic felt his own struggle with loneliness understood and clarified – which is to say: seen. 
https://t.co/JZ8abAs2jP

name: NPR
text:
Israelis and Emiratis are publicly celebrating and making travel plans as their two countries plan to open normal relations. 

But there are dissenters who question what this deal will really mean.
https://t.co/XYR0BqA58S

name: NPR
text:
The sheer volume of stuff acquired through generations — plus any emotional ties to it — can complicate decluttering. Like Marie Kondo, Julie Hall starts with a question.

" 'Do I like you? Yes...but do I love you?'" 

If the answer is no, "I let it go." https://t.co/yJt3FrDClj

name: NPR
text: RT @HowIBuiltThis: When Guy Raz gets interviewed by someone else https://t.co/T0JZO6u2yy

name: NPR
text:
During past storms, gyms and stadiums turned into giant shelters. 

But with COVID-19 cases rising before Hurricane Laura, those shelters — and other protocols for evacuation and recovery — represented a new danger of their own. 
https://t.co/6v9cqYLMBm

name: NPR
text:
On this weeks @npritsbeenamin with guest host @elisewho! We ask:

- What does childcare cost in the time of #coronavirus?
- Why is there a shortage of childcare providers?
- What do #mukbang and true crime have in common? Stephanie Soo tells us. https://t.co/5q5GIaM8mn

name: NPR
text:
After 72 hours of searching for a possible survivor trapped underneath the rubble of a collapsed building in Beirut, rescuers have ended their operation.

"Unfortunately, today, we can say there's no sign of life," one said. 
 https://t.co/RWYkrLcqvB

name: NPR
text:
Young Tunisians are angry that conditions have worsened since the 2011 Arab Spring uprising. And they don't trust the political process to make improvements.

It's led to protests, including suicide — often as self-immolations outside municipal buildings. https://t.co/beTdpDka8k

name: NPR
text: If you or someone you know may be considering suicide, contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-27… https://t.co/rXaJp4pxVH
